intro: Rhexia sileniflora, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. The plant has a distinctive reddish-brown root system, which gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats. Rhexia sileniflora is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
